title: Facebook says 100 app developers could have improperly accessed user data for months
text: Dozens of third-party apps may have had access to certain Facebook user data for months after the company moved to place limits on that information, the social media giant said on Tuesday.

title: Facebook says 100 software developers may have improperly accessed user data
text: Facebook on Tuesday disclosed that as many as 100 software developers may have improperly accessed user data, including the names and profile pictures of people in specific groups on the social network.

title: Al Sharpton takes Facebook ad concerns to Mark Zuckerberg’s home
text: Civil rights activist Reverend Al Sharpton said he had a “no-holds-barred meeting” with Mark Zuckerberg at the Facebook CEO’s home on Monday over the company’s decision not to fact-check ads and other content from politicians. The meeting, which Sharpton said lasted nearly two hours at Zuckerberg’s Palo Alto house, included multiple civil rights activists and Facebook’s.

title: Facebook may soon scan your face to verify your identity
text:
Facebook will ask users to upload a video selfie to prove their identity but promises  “no one else will see” your video.
Facebook is testing a feature that will require users to scan their faces to verify their identity on the platform under certain conditions.

title: Facebook changes logo - to avoid confusion with Facebook
text: Facebook, the company behind the social media platform also called Facebook, wants to avoid being confused with Facebook - but instead of changing its name, like Google did to Alphabet, it is changing its logo.
